If you are a fan of Zorro, Indiana Jones, or action in general this is a must-see. Directed by Republic's ace team of William Witney and John English and starring John Carroll, Eric Campbell, and Noble Johnson with enough bad guys to necessitate the terms "Calico Kid" and "Spaniards dishonorably slain," this film has everything from fistfights to fistfights with snakes! A woman who hates cats (Alice Krige) and her son (Brian Krause) have moved into a small town, and must deal with a mean cat. The townspeople form a posse to destroy the animal, and things seem to be just fine. Well, until they find that one cat has been turned into an unstoppable killing machine, and is ripping its way through the town. Then a sequel inevitably followed starring John Rhys-Davies and Diane Ladd
